intro: Cotoneaster gilgitensis, commonly known as the Gilgit cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the high mountain regions of northern Pakistan and parts of India. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by red or orange berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in cold, alpine environments and is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils.
